trouble in Paris and forgotten but still
memorialized good evening this is the
New York Times minute another move today
in a legal fight between the federal
government and Utah the Justice
Department announced it would recognize
the marriages of 1300 gay couples
performed in the state last month as
lawful and considered eligible for all
relevant federal benefits this comes two
days after Utah refused to recognize the
marriages while a court battle plays out
in Paris president Francois Hollande who
is not married but in a public
relationship with another woman has
threatened to sue a tabloid after an
account of a purported affair in years
past the amorous lives of French public
officials might have remained unwritten
gossip and if you're in New York
something different to do this weekend
you may have no idea who Alexander
